Grain.Do: Warm, cooked grains like quinoa (1 cup cooked), basmati rice (1 cup cooked), oats (1/2 cup dry), whole wheat roti (2 small). Focus on grounding, nourishing grains.
Grain.Dont: Dry, light, or cold grains like puffed rice, crackers, very stale bread. Avoid excessive consumption of refined grains.

Legume.Do: Well-cooked and spiced lentils like moong dal (1/2 cup cooked), masoor dal (1/2 cup cooked), split peas (1/2 cup cooked). Start with small, easily digestible portions.
Legume.Dont: Raw or undercooked legumes, large quantities of beans like rajma or chana, especially if they cause gas. Avoid fermented legumes.

Veg.Do: Cooked and warming vegetables like sweet potatoes (1 cup cooked), carrots (1 cup cooked), zucchini (1 cup cooked), asparagus (1 cup cooked), beets (1/2 cup cooked). Favor root vegetables and gourds.
Veg.Dont: Raw, cold, or bitter vegetables like raw salads, broccoli, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts in large amounts. Avoid very pungent vegetables like raw garlic or onion.

Spices.Do: Warming and digestive spices like ginger (fresh, 1-inch piece), cumin (1 tsp), coriander (1 tsp), cardamom (2-3 pods), turmeric (1/2 tsp). Use liberally in cooking.
Spices.Dont: Overly pungent, hot, or drying spices like excessive red chili powder, black pepper, mustard seeds in excess. Avoid very bitter spices.

Leafy veg.Do: Cooked leafy greens like spinach (1 cup cooked), fenugreek leaves (methi) (1 cup cooked), swiss chard (1 cup cooked). Ensure they are well-cooked and warm.
Leafy veg.Dont: Raw leafy greens, large quantities of very bitter greens like kale in raw form.

Oil.Do: Warming and grounding oils like ghee (1-2 tbsp), sesame oil (1 tbsp), almond oil (1 tbsp). Use in cooking and for gentle massage.
Oil.Dont: Excessive use of light or cold oils like sunflower oil, corn oil. Avoid rancid oils.

Fruits.Do: Sweet, ripe, and juicy fruits like bananas (1 medium), dates (2-3), figs (2-3), ripe mango (1/2 cup), pears (1 medium). Best eaten between meals or as part of breakfast.
Fruits.Dont: Raw, unripe, or very sour fruits like unripe apples, cranberries, dried fruits without soaking (except dates/figs). Avoid fruit juices that are too cold or processed.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Soaked and ground nuts like almonds (5-7 soaked, peeled), walnuts (3-4), pistachios (5-7). Dates (2-3), figs (2-3). Have in moderation, preferably soaked.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Dry, unsoaked nuts in large quantities, roasted and salted nuts. Avoid excessive dry fruits that can be too heating.

Milk product.Do: Warm, whole milk (1 cup) with spices like cardamom or turmeric, yogurt (1/2 cup) mixed with water (lassi) and spices, ghee (1-2 tbsp).
Milk product.Dont: Cold milk, ice cream, excessive amounts of hard cheeses, yogurt at night. Avoid skimmed or low-fat dairy.

Non-veg.Do: Well-cooked and easily digestible meats like chicken soup (1 bowl), fish (100g cooked, mild preparation), eggs (1-2 cooked). Focus on nourishing, warm preparations.
Non-veg.Dont: Fried or dry meats, heavy red meats, processed meats, raw or undercooked meat. Avoid very spicy non-veg dishes.

Condiments.Do: Sweet and sour chutneys, mild spice mixes, warm herbal teas like ginger-mint tea. A small amount of rock salt.
Condiments.Dont: Extremely spicy pickles, very sour or fermented condiments, overly processed sauces. Avoid ice-cold beverages.
